subtitle: welcome to meaningful Monday's where we
answer your personal questions the
question this week is I am in an
unstable marriage with a spouse who's
emotionally unwell despite seeing all of
the appropriate professionals and
improving in some areas my spouse has
yet to improve many aspects of his
behavior I've recently succumbed to
outrageous panic attacks in which i lash
out against my spouse and say or
threaten irrational things I've even
threatened suicide on various occasions
I don't really mean it on some level I
feel that is the only way to get him to
stop focusing on himself and get his act
together it has ceased to work and
needless to say i need to stop these
outbursts how can I stop them and help
my marriage take a turn for the better
in all given area is because we're all
so objective and biased especially when
it involved in emotional situation it's
critical that you find a professional an
objective professional that can give you
a diagnosis and understanding of what is
really going on both with your husband
and with your reactions and impulsive
behavior does not help anything once you
have a diagnosis you have clarity you
have clarity is your husband in the
situation that he can do something about
his emotional situation or is it
something he cannot do you know would
you complain or have any type of
grievance against a husband for example
god forbid that contracted heart disease
that's the situation and you as partners
have to figure out what to do about it
if on the other hand your husband can do
something about the situation then you
need to find professionals find therapy
and find ways to intervene but just
reacting and thinking that your methods
are going to work can be actually cause
more detrimental effects than anything
positive if you truly love your husband
and he loves you every problem can be
addressed and solved the first thing
that establishes the diagnosis your
partners are you partners in dealing
with the situation or you're not and
beyond knowing more details that the
best type of advice I can give may God
bless you and everyone to find the
healthiest type of solutions to
challenges in our mare
it's always worth it when you make that
effort you never know what kind of
forces and strengths you'll discover
when you apply yourself this has been
meaningful Monday's with sim and
Jacobson you can submit your question by
